content.description: One of the best problems in Roosevelt. Narrow crimps and bad feet are what define this 5 degree slab. Start is standing with two hands on the angled crimp rail located around average head height on the left side. Climb straight up using whatever features you can find to the right of the thin vertical crack. Knock on the rock near the bottom to find the hollow parts to avoid. The crux is getting to the large horizontal crack near the top. Top out to finish the climb.
content.location: The leftmost slab on Red Trail South. Climb the face to the right of the thin vertical crack.

content.description: Follow the thin crack up to top out. This shallow flared crack goes easiest with good thin crack technique. Using face holds does not seem to make the climb significantly easier.
content.location: The thin vertical crack to the left of King Ramses' Curse slab at Red Trail South.

content.description: Home to one of the best climbs in Roosevelt, King Ramses' Curse. Beginner level  problems abound on the right end of the wall. On the leftmost 4 m (13 ft) slab is Crackin' the Tomb, a thin crack climb, and King Ramses' Curse a slab climb.
